page.title: 16Metro-Land in Chorleywood
page.content: Once the grand dream of linking Manchester with Paris via London and a Channel Tunnel had died the Metropolitan Railway looked at the idea of buying up land bordering their railway and building residential properties developing quiet country suberbs. This they sold as their idea of Metro-Land and much of Chorleywoods growth in the 1930's, and subsequent popularity is linked to the Metropolitan Railway. The earliest cottages built by the Railway Company were in Colley Land in the 1890's for their labourers. However their main Metro-Land development took place in the 1930's with the building of a large number of houses. The station is just as important today as the majority of working men in Chorleywood commute to work. (Of 80 children only 3 dads worked locally).
